info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:57PM EDT by NWS Jackson KY
info.description:
At 157 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Pyramid to Soft Shell. Movement was east at 55 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Pikeville, Estill, Coal Run Village, Martin, Wayland, Allen, East McDowell, Meta, Hippo, Handshoe, Glo, Printer, Aluba, McDowell, Betsy Layne, Ivel, Honaker, Blue Moon, Osborn, and Orkney.
THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 12. Kentucky Highway 80 in Knott County between mile markers 12 and 20. U.S. Highway 119 in Pike County between mile markers 1 and 16. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 9. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 19 and 32.
info.instruction:
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN KNOTT...CENTRAL FLOYD...NORTHWESTERN PIKE AND SOUTHEASTERN MAGOFFIN COUNTIES THROUGH 230 PM EDT
